title: 50 mind-blowing science facts about our incredible world
summary: If you're looking for weird facts about animals, gross human body facts or just something a bit random, get ready to geek out with these fascinating bits of trivia.

title: T. rex quiz: How much do you really know about the king of the dinosaurs?
summary: Almost everyone has heard of Tyrannosaurus rex, but how much do you actually know about this iconic dinosaur predator? Take our quiz to find out.

title: Hundreds of iceberg earthquakes are shaking the crumbling end of Antarctica's Doomsday Glacier
summary: Glacial earthquakes are rocking the Doomsday Glacier in Antarctica.

title: A New Bridge Links the Strange Math of Infinity to Computer Science
summary: Descriptive set theorists study the niche mathematics of infinity. Now, they’ve shown that their problems can be rewritten in the concrete language of algorithms.

title: Giant 'cow of the Cretaceous' discovered almost 100 years ago identified as new duck-billed dinosaur
summary: The dino lived during the Late Cretaceous alongside other hadrosaurids in present-day New Mexico.

title: Mysterious Voynich manuscript may be a cipher, a new study suggests

title: Yellowstone quiz: How much do you know about the first national park?
summary: Crammed full of epic scenery, steaming geysers, plants and animals, Yellowstone National Park is a spectacular place to visit, but how hot is your knowledge on it? Take our quiz to find out.

title: Spotted Lake: Canada's soda lake with colorful brine pools that are smelly and slimy 'like the white of an egg'
summary: Spotted Lake is a soda lake that evaporates every summer, leaving a white crust with circular brine pools that can appear blue, green or yellow.

title: Trees in Panama's tropical forests are growing longer roots in the face of drought
summary: A long-term experiment reveals tropical forests in Panama are able to adapt to droughts, but scientists warn this short-term "rescue strategy" is unlikely to save them from the impacts of climate change.

title: January 'Wolf Supermoon': How to see the full moon rise with Jupiter this weekend
summary: The first full moon of 2026 and of winter in the Northern Hemisphere will shine brightly this week, just as Earth makes its annual closest approach to the sun.

title: Melting of West Antarctic ice sheet could trigger catastrophic reshaping of the land beneath
summary: A picture of what West Antarctica looked like when its ice sheet melted in the past can offer insight into the continent’s future as the climate warms.

title: Quadrantid meteor shower peaks this week: How to see the first 'shooting' stars of the year
summary: The Quadrantids will be harder to see than usual due to the bright full moon. Here's how to get the best views.

title: Centuries-old 'trophy head' from Peru reveals individual survived to adulthood despite disabling birth defect
summary: A researcher has documented a cleft lip in an ancient mummified head from the Andes, a condition that may have been seen as a "blessing" rather than a disability.

title: Massive Myanmar earthquake was super smooth and efficient — and it holds lessons for the 'Big One'
summary: The fault that ruptured in the March quake was simple and mature, which allowed the quake's energy to shoot right to the surface.

title: Tractor beams inspired by sci-fi are real, and could solve the looming space junk problem
summary: Researchers are developing a real-life tractor beam, with the goal of pulling defunct satellites out of geostationary orbit to alleviate the space junk problem.

title: See the exact point where a glacier, a lake and a river 'touch' in Argentina — Earth from space
summary: A 2021 astronaut photo shows a triple valley system in Argentina's Los Glaciares National Park where a massive climate-resilient glacier, a pristine turquoise lake and a murky green "river" come together at a single point.

title: How many holes does the human body have?
summary: You might think that the human body has many holes, but that number shrinks when you stop to consider what counts as a hole.

title: تعرف عليهم.. 4 أفلام عربية مرشحة لجائزة الأوسكار
summary: في سابقة تاريخية، دخلت 4 أفلام عربية سباق المنافسة على جائزة أوسكار أفضل فيلم دولي، التي تمنحها سنويا أكاديمية علوم وفنون السينما الأميركية للأعمال المنتَجة خارج الولايات المتحدة.
